017package org.microbean.loader;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.Type;
020
021import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
022import java.util.Properties;
023
024import java.util.function.Supplier;
025
026import org.microbean.loader.api.Loader;
027
028import org.microbean.loader.spi.AbstractProvider;
029import org.microbean.loader.spi.Value;
030
031import org.microbean.path.Path;
032import org.microbean.path.Path.Element;
033
034import org.microbean.qualifier.Qualifiers;
035
036import org.microbean.type.JavaTypes;
037
038/**
039 * An {@link AbstractProvider} that can return {@link Value}s backed
040 * by System properties.
041 *
042 * <p>While System properties are often casually assumed to be stable
043 * and {@link String}-typed, the exact opposite is true: System
044 * properties may contain arbitrarily-typed {@link Object}s under
045 * arbitrarily-typed keys, and the properties themselves {@linkplain
046 * System#setProperties(Properties) may be replaced} at any point.
047 * This means that all {@link Value}s supplied by this {@link
048 * SystemPropertyProvider} are {@linkplain Value#determinism()
049 * non-deterministic} and may change type and presence from one call
050 * to another.</p>
051 *
052 * <p>It is also worth mentioning explicitly that, deliberately, no
053 * type conversion of any System property value takes place in this
054 * class.</p>
055 *
056 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
057 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
058 *
059 * @see System#getProperty(String, String)
060 *
061 * @see System#getProperties()
062 *
063 * @see System#setProperties(Properties)
064 *
065 * @see Properties#getProperty(String, String)
066 *
067 * @see Value#determinism()
068 */
069public final class SystemPropertyProvider extends AbstractProvider {
070
071
072  /*
073   * Constructors.
074   */
075
076
077  /**
078   * Creates a new {@link SystemPropertyProvider}.
079   */
080  public SystemPropertyProvider() {
081    super();
082  }
083
084
085  /*
086   * Instance methods.
087   */
088
089
090  /**
091   * Returns a {@link Supplier} suitable for the System property
092   * represented by the supplied {@link Path}.
093   *
094   * <p>This method never returns {@code null}.  Its overrides may if
095   * they wish.</p>
096   *
097   * <p>The {@linkplain Path.Element#name() name} of the {@linkplain
098   * Path#lastElement() last element} of the supplied {@link Path} is
099   * taken to be the name of the System property value to retrieve.
100   * If the {@linkplain JavaTypes#erase(Type) type erasure} of the
101   * supplied {@link Path}'s {@link Path#qualified() qualified()}
102   * method {@linkplain Class#isAssignableFrom(Class) is assignable
103   * from} {@link String String.class}, then calls will be made by the
104   * returned {@link Value}'s {@link Value#get() get()} method to
105   * {@link System#getProperty(String)} before simple calls to {@link
106   * Properties#get(String) System.getProperties().get(String)}.</p>
107   *
108   * <p>Any {@link Supplier} returned by this method will be
109   * {@linkplain
110   * org.microbean.invoke.OptionalSupplier.Determinism#NON_DETERMINISTIC
111   * non-deterministic}, since system properties may change at any
112   * point.  Additionally, if the supplied {@link Path}'s {@linkplain
113   * Path#qualified() type} is not assignable from that borne by a
114   * System property value, then the {@link Supplier} will return
115   * {@code null} from its {@link Value#get() get()} method in such a
116   * case, indicating that the value is present but cannot be
117   * represented.  Overrides are strongly encouraged to abide by these
118   * conditions.</p>
119   *
120   * @param requestor the {@link Loader} seeking a {@link Value}; must
121   * not be {@code null}
122   *
123   * @param absolutePath an {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute
124   * <code>Path</code>} for which a {@link Value} is being sought;
125   * must not be {@code null}
126   *
127   * @return a {@link Supplier} suitable for the System property whose
128   * name is represented by the supplied {@link Path}'s {@linkplain
129   * Path#lastElement() last <code>Element</code>}'s {@linkplain
130   * Path.Element#name() name}
131   *
132   * @exception NullPointerException if an argument for either
133   * parameter is {@code null}
134   *
135   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null} but its
136   * overrides may.
137   *
138   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
139   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
140   *
141   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
142   * Overrides must be idempotent, but need not be deterministic.
143   * {@link Supplier}s returned by this method or its overrides are
144   * <em>not</em> guaranteed to be idempotent or deterministic.
145   */
146  @Override
147  protected Supplier<?> find(final Loader<?> requestor, final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath) {
148    assert absolutePath.absolute();
149    assert absolutePath.startsWith(requestor.path());
150    assert !absolutePath.equals(requestor.path());
151
152    if (absolutePath.size() == 2) { // root + name
153      final Element<? extends Type> last = absolutePath.lastElement();
154      final String name = last.name();
155      if (!name.isEmpty()) {
156        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
157        final Class<?> pathTypeErasure = JavaTypes.erase(absolutePath.qualified());
158        final Supplier<?> s;
159        if (CharSequence.class.isAssignableFrom(pathTypeErasure)) {
160          s = () -> getCharSequenceAssignableSystemProperty(name, pathTypeErasure);
161        } else {
162          s = () -> getSystemProperty(name, pathTypeErasure);
163        }
164        return s;
165      }
166    }
167    return null;
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Overrides the {@link AbstractProvider#path(Loader, Path)} method
172   * to return a {@link Path} consisting solely of the {@linkplain
173   * Path#lastElement() last element} of the supplied {@code
174   * absolutePath}.
175   *
176   * @param requestor the {@link Loader} seeking a {@link Value}; must
177   * not be {@code null}
178   *
179   * @param absolutePath an {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute
180   * <code>Path</code>} for which a {@link Value} is being sought;
181   * must not be {@code null}
182   *
183   * @return a {@link Path} that will be {@linkplain
184   * Value#Value(Supplier, Path) used to build a <code>Value</code>}
185   * to be returned by the {@link #get(Loader, Path)} method
186   *
187   * @nullability This method does not, but overrides may, return
188   * {@code null}.
189   *
190   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
191   * idempotent and deterministic.
192   *
193   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
194   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
195   *
196   * @see AbstractProvider#path(Loader, Path)
197   */
198  @Override
199  protected <T extends Type> Path<T> path(final Loader<?> requestor, final Path<T> absolutePath) {
200    return Path.of(absolutePath.lastElement());
201  }
202
203
204  /*
205   * Static methods.
206   */
207
208
209  private static final <T> T getCharSequenceAssignableSystemProperty(final String propertyName, final Class<T> typeErasure) {
210    assert CharSequence.class.isAssignableFrom(typeErasure) : "typeErasure: " + typeErasure.getName();
211    Object value = System.getProperty(propertyName);
212    if (value == null) {
213      final Properties systemProperties = System.getProperties();
214      value = systemProperties.getProperty(propertyName);
215      if (value == null) {
216        value = systemProperties.get(propertyName);
217      }
218    }
219    if (typeErasure.isInstance(value)) {
220      return typeErasure.cast(value);
221    }
222    throw new NoSuchElementException(propertyName);
223  }
224
225  private static final <T> T getSystemProperty(final String propertyName, final Class<T> typeErasure) {
226    assert !CharSequence.class.isAssignableFrom(typeErasure) : "typeErasure: " + typeErasure.getName();
227    final Object value = System.getProperties().get(propertyName);
228    if (typeErasure.isInstance(value)) {
229      return typeErasure.cast(value);
230    }
231    throw new NoSuchElementException(propertyName);
232  }
233
234}
